title: Craft Practices
description: Practices that maintain and elevate the quality of our work
philosophy: God is in the details. Every line of code is an opportunity for excellence.

practices.name: Code as Craft Review
practices.purpose: Ensure every commit reflects our commitment to excellence

steps.guidance: Read through all changes as if reviewing a colleague's work
Will this be clear to someone reading it in 6 months?
Are tests present? Is documentation updated?
Could this change harm users or systems?

checklist: [ ] No debug code or temporary hacks
reflection_prompts: Would I be proud to show this to a mentor?
Is this the simplest solution that works?
Have I left the codebase better than I found it?
success_indicators: Code passes review without major issues
Commit history tells a clear story

practices.name: Thoughtful Code Review

steps.guidance: Read the ticket/spec to understand the goal
Does the overall approach make sense?
Check logic, edge cases, error handling
Will this serve our stakeholders well?
Call out what was done well

review_dimensions: Correctness: Does it do what it should?
Consistency: Does it follow our patterns?
reflection_prompts: Would this code survive contact with real users?
What can I learn from how this was implemented?
How can my feedback help the author grow?

practices.name: Continuous Refactoring
practices.purpose: Leave every file better than you found it
practices.boy_scout_rule: Always leave the campground cleaner than you found it

steps.guidance: While working, observe code that could be clearer
Rename unclear variables, extract methods, simplify logic
Don't mix refactoring with feature work

reflection_prompts: Is this code clearer than before?
Did I reduce complexity or add to it?
Will the next person thank me or curse me?
success_indicators: Code quality trends upward over time
